page.title: 06Rugden and Ham Green Farm
page.content:
{ Rugden}is approached by a long bumpy drive. The house was built between the 13th and 14th centuries, one barn is the same age as the house and all the buildings are old. They have between 250 and 300 sheep including the lambs. They own 11 pheasant - 3 cocks and 8 hens and their 3 dogs live in an old caravan. Near the house there is a 25 foot deep well.
At{Ham Green Farm,}Mr. Pudan took us into the old dairy and showed us a milk cooler and a filter to get rid of the dirt. We saw where one of the natural springs on his land is and had a look at the calves and the turkey sheds. Mr. Pudan rode off on his bike and showed us the way to the badger sets; there were lots of sets but we did not see any badgers as they are nocturnal.
